== Introduction ==
{| class="wikitable"

In this guide, I have provide workaround for screen resolution issue. Hopefully this workaround should work in all Ubuntu.

'''Note:''' ''I have tested only for Intel Graphics Controller.''
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <(-2 tablewidth="90%" style="border:none">  1. Go to '''System''' ---> '''Preferences''' ---> '''Display'''
|-
| <( width="10%" style="border:none">
| <( style="border:none"><nowiki>[[File:menu.png]]</nowiki>
|}

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <(-2 tablewidth="90%" style="border:none">  2. You will see a screen similar to the following, where you can change refresh rate, resolution, rotation and detecting monitors.
|-
| <( width="20%" style="border:none">
| <( style="border:none"><nowiki>[[File:display preferences.png]]</nowiki>
|}

* In this screen as you see monitor will not get detected and you will not have options to change refresh rate, resolution and rotation.
== Workaround ==
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <(-2 tablewidth="90%" style="border:none">  1. To know what is your controller open a terminal and execute the following command :
|}
<pre>
$ sudo lspci | grep -i vga
</pre>
It should give message like this:
<pre>
$ sudo lspci | grep -i vga
  00:02.0 VGA compatible controller: Intel Corporation Mobile GM965/GL960 Integrated Graphics
  Controller (rev 0c) 
</pre>

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <(-2 tablewidth="90%" style="border:none">  2. Make sure that your hardware is not in the blacklist. Modify the script /usr/bin/compiz. Open a terminal and execute the following command :
|}
<pre>
$ sudo gedit /usr/bin/compiz
</pre>
Search in the file the lines about the blacklist. There should be a pair of lines with your (i.e. intel) graphic card. Comment them out (meaning: put a '#' at the beginning of the line).

It should look like this:
<pre>
BLACKLIST_PCIIDS="$T" 
unset T
</pre>

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <(-2 tablewidth="90%" style="border:none">  3. In xorg.conf, replace "vesa" with "intel". Open a terminal and execute the following command :
|}
'''Note:''' ''Make sure you take a backup of xorg.conf before editing.''
<pre>
$ sudo gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf
</pre>
* Search for “vesa” and replace it with “intel”.
* Save and close the file.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <(-2 tablewidth="90%" style="border:none">  4. Restart the computer and now you can change refresh rate, resolution, rotation and detecting monitors.
|}
